title: File System Operations in Shell
description: In this lab, you will learn how to perform various file tests in the shell. File tests are useful for checking the properties of files and directories in the file system. You will familiarize yourself with common file test commands and their usage.

meta.title: File Tests in Bash | Shell Scripting Tutorials
meta.description: Learn how to perform various file tests in the shell, including checking if a file exists, and explore common file test commands and their usage.
meta.keywords: file tests, shell scripting, bash, file existence, file system, shell commands

verify.name: Verify current directory
verify.hint: Make sure you are in the /home/labex/project directory. You can change to this directory using the command: cd /home/labex/project

verify.name: Verify test file creation and content
verify.hint: Make sure you have created the file test_file.txt and it contains the phrase "test file". You can create it using: echo "This is a test file for our lab." > test_file.txt

verify.name: Verify file_exists.sh script
verify.hint: Ensure that file_exists.sh exists and contains the line setting the filename variable. You can create it using nano file_exists.sh

verify.name: Verify dir_exists.sh script and directory creation
verify.hint: Make sure you have created both the dir_exists.sh script and the test_directory. You can create the directory using: mkdir test_directory

verify.name: Verify file_readable.sh script and file permissions
verify.hint: Ensure that file_readable.sh exists and test_file.txt has read permissions. You can add read permissions using: chmod +r test_file.txt
